original: HILDEBRAND, Karl Emil Hildebrand, Fil Dr, Stockholm, f Sthlm 24/9 70 av riksantikv Hans H o Elin Martin, gm Elisabeth af Geijerstam. Besk sk, fil kand Upps 91, fil lic 96, fil dr 98. Doc i hist 98—02, pol medarb o bitr red Sthlms Dagbl 01, huv.red 04—13, vkst dir t 13. 2:a karnm 07—08 (lex Hildebrand) o 12—18, tobaksutsk 14 b, konstit.-utsk 12—18, heml utsk 17, l:a kamm (h) 09— 10, riksg.flm 16, ordf 25—41, led FHK, ch f upplysn.avd 17, fd led allm Valm.frb överstyr. V. ordf Sv allm hypot.bk 29—42, Sv bost.kred.kassan 33—41, styr.ordf Pumpseparator, styr.led Göta kanalbol, ordf livf.bol Framtiden. Ekon stud Brasilien 13, nya ös-tersjöstat 23 o 25. Av trycket: Sthlms hist, Johan III o Europ katolska makter, Arb :s frnsrätt, Demokrati, Kommunal el ensk drift? Ett starkt folk, Donaumonarkin i krig, De sv statsmakterna o krigstidens folkhush, Handb i folkhush.frågor, Gustaf V, Det gamla o det nya Kina, Femårsplanen o den ryska exp, Fackfrnsrör o samhället (m Axel Brunius), Riksg.kont hist 1789—1934 (i Sv:es riksd XIII), Afrika, Sieverts kabelverk. Riksg.kont 1789—1939, Sv fastigh.äg.frb 1914—39, utg Urkunder t Sthlms hist, medred av Uppland sed. 01, red 39 av sv uppl av Vogel-J0rgensens Världen sed. 1914. GV:sJmt, Km-stkNO, KVOlkl, StkLettSO, KIFOlkl, StOff-LitGedO, LSkS.
translated: HILDEBRAND, Karl Emil Hildebrand, PhD, Stockholm, born in Stockholm on September 24, 1870, son of the National Antiquarian Hans H and Elin Martin, married to Elisabeth af Geijerstam. Visited school, studied philosophy at Uppsala University in 1891, obtained a bachelor's degree in philosophy in 1896, a licentiate degree in 1898, and a PhD in 1898. Worked as a docent in history from 1898 to 1902, political collaborator and assistant editor at Stockholm's Dagblad from 1901, chief editor from 1904 to 1913, and deputy director since 1913. Member of the second chamber of parliament from 1907 to 1908 (according to the Hildebrand lexicon) and from 1912 to 1918, member of the tobacco committee in 1914, member of the constitutional committee from 1912 to 1918, member of the secret committee in 1917, member of the first chamber (house of nobility) from 1909 to 1910, member of the foreign affairs committee in 1916, chairman from 1925 to 1941, member of the board of the Swedish Historical Society, chairman of the enlightenment department since 1917, former member of the general election committee for the upper house. Vice chairman of the Swedish public mortgage bank from 1929 to 1942, chairman of the Swedish housing credit fund from 1933 to 1941, chairman of Pumpseparator, board member of the Göta Canal Company, chairman of the life insurance company Framtiden. Studied economics in Brazil in 1913, studied the new Baltic states in 1923 and 1925. Published works include: "Stockholm's history," "Johan III and the Catholic powers of Europe," "Laborer's rights," "Democracy," "Municipal or private management? A strong people," "The Danube monarchy in war," "The Swedish authorities and wartime public household," "Handbook on public household issues," "Gustaf V," "Old and new China," "The five-year plan and Russian expansion," "Trade unions and society" (with Axel Brunius), "The history of the national control agency 1789-1934" (in the Swedish parliament's XIII session), "Africa," "Sieverts cable factory," "The national control agency 1789-1939," "Swedish property owners association 1914-1939," edited "Documents on Stockholm's history," co-editor of Uppland since 1901, and editor since 1939 of the Swedish edition of Vogel-Jorgensen's "The World" since 1914. Recipient of the Grand Cross of the Order of Vasa with the star, Grand Cross of the Order of the Polar Star, Commander of the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, Grand Officer of the Order of the Crown (Belgium), Knight First Class of the Order of the Lithuanian Grand Duke Gediminas, Commander of the Order of Academic Palms (France), and the Swedish Society for Anthropology and Geography's Golden Medal. Note: "GV'sJmt" refers to the Order of Vasa, "Km-stkNO" to the Order of the Polar Star, "KVOlkl" to the Royal Norwegian Order of St. Olav, "StkLettSO" to the Order of the Crown (Belgium), "KIFOlkl" to the Order of the Lithuanian Grand Duke Gediminas, "StOff-LitGedO" to Commander of the Order of Academic Palms (France), and "LSkS" to the Swedish Society for Anthropology and Geography's Golden Medal.
